title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Illinois State (Normal, IL)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was extensive, well structured, and involved multiple departmental stakeholders. Each interview was conducted in a professional manner with defined questions that involved an open channel of communication with opportunities to build on responses.
Interview Questions: Q: What attracted you to ISU and the position in which you are applying?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Illinois State
Interview Descriptions: The interview was quick and straight forward process. Interviewers were friendly and personable. There was not a phone interview, only in person. The interview was more conversational and not intimidating.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have teaching a course like ….?

title: Intramural Referee Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Illinois State
Interview Descriptions: Thorough and helps prepare for future interviews after college. You are required to dress and prepare like any other job. The questions are not insanely difficult, but they give you an opportunity to speak on your experience and abilities.
Interview Questions: How have you handled angry customers in the past?

title: Client Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Illinois State
Interview Descriptions: had to do testing first, easy, lots of math questions but they were easy questions. phone interview then in person. tour of the office and met staff. overall good impression and good employer
Interview Questions: name a time you had to handle an irate customer

title: Event Staff Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Illinois State
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was smooth and they want to hire you. They need a lot of people and if you are willing to work a lot of weekends this is job for you
Interview Questions: Past experiences were asked and if you are available to work all football games

title: Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Illinois State
Interview Descriptions: Zoom interview with hiring managers.  I recommend having completed projects available to discuss.  The interview lasted around an hour.  Standard interview questions were asked in relation to the position.  After a week, an offer was made.
Interview Questions: Standard interview questions were asked.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Illinois State
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, got an email to come in for an interview two weeks later. It was a panel interview with three people. I attended the interview and received an offer two weeks later. Overall, the process was great, the people I contacted for updates were quick with responses.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself

title: Programming Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Illinois State (Normal, IL) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was very easy and fun and I am very glad that I did it. I would recommend that anyone who wants to do it does it because it was so fun and I love it.
Interview Questions: What is your experience in life?

title: Development Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Illinois State
Interview Descriptions: Phone Interview followed by 1/2 day on campus interview. There were many break out sessions to meet with different people you would work with. Some were more organized than others
Interview Questions: Relating Experience to job

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Illinois State (Normal, IL) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: It's a simple application process. You look for the program of interest to you on the website. Apply for it; make sure to provide all the required documents as stated. Be honest in your statement of Purpose yet make sure you are selling yourself well.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in a GA position?

title: Information Technology Technical Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Illinois State (Normal, IL)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was called a week later to schedule an interview.  The first interview consisted of questions on my experience and creating a diagram. I got a call for a second interview a few days later for a second technical interview. The second interview consisted of 45 minutes to analyse a Powershell script, SQL script, and log file, as well as setup a web server on a Linux virtual machine, followed by basic interview questions.
Interview Questions: When did something you were working on not go how you wanted, how did you deal with it, and what did you learn from it?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Illinois State (Normal, IL) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was a very straightforward process to gauge skill set and fit for position. Ask questions about experience and long term goals to determine how well you fit the culture they’re building.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Illinois State
Interview Descriptions: Easy to apply on the Illinois State Website, emailed quickly from person conductin the interview,  very friendly staff during the whole process, seems like a great place to work.
Interview Questions: What qualities do you have that make an effective teacher?

title: Assistant Director of Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Illinois State
Interview Descriptions: On the phone for 10 min. Series of questions with 5 or 6 people. It was difficult to hear some of the questions clearly.  The interview was awkward. Know the position duties. It was difficult to find the job duties online especially applying for more than one job position.
Interview Questions: Why was I interested in the job? What process would I use to achieve the job? How would I handle conflict? Give examples of work achievement

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Illinois State
Interview Descriptions: For Graduate Assistant positions, they rarely do a real interview. It usually depends on your resume, your experience and if you know enough contacts inside the university. And this is everything I can tell about the process.
Interview Questions: What is your work experience?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Illinois State
Interview Descriptions: Easy. Well organized interview by committee members. Questions were basic and can be answered easily. Questions were based on previous work experience, handling stress, multitasking, time management, coding experience etc.
Interview Questions: How you manage stress?

title: IT Support Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Illinois State (Normal, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was more of a discussion then a physical test to see if I could do basic things of the job.  Very hands on.  The group panel consisted of the manager, team, and another person who would be someone that you would support.
Interview Questions: Why work here?

title: Faculty Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Illinois State
Interview Descriptions: Two day campus visit with administration meetings, teaching demo and research talk.  All meals included and tour of area. Also had the opportunity to meet with the annual review committee, technology support and research office.
Interview Questions: Teaching philosophy

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Illinois State (Normal, IL) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Set up interview through the phone  was the first set, then we had a 1:1 interview. They offered me the job on the spot it was a pretty easy interview. He explained everything about the job and told me the hours that they had available
Interview Questions: Q: What can you tell me about yourself?

title: Quality Assurance Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Illinois State (Normal, IL) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a very straightforward interview. It consisted of very basic questions such as "tell us about yourself" to begin, "what are your strengths and weaknesses", etc. It was a friendly environment and allowed for good communication between the interviewer and myself. I was interviewed by three people, though this was a very informal interview.
Interview Questions: How would you manage your time working under a time constraint?

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Illinois State (Normal, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Talked with several faculty about their research, attended faculty seminar, lunch with graduate students, small reception/dinner after. Very informal, laid back. Everyone was interesting and helpful. Wanted to get to know the candidates
Interview Questions: Lab experience, future goals

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Illinois State (Normal, IL) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: No interview, application only. The position was assigned to an incoming graduate student. Some students were given the opportunity to become teaching assistants, but my experience better suited me for a research assistantship.
Interview Questions: Previous research experiance

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Illinois State
Interview Descriptions: The interview wasn't that bad. It was kind of far to bloomington but not too bad. The interview itself was average. I would do it again. Illinois State is a good school with alot of people that go there, primarily from Chicago suburbs. I think the internship would be a valuable experience but I am not entirely sure.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Illinois State (Normal, IL) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Had a phone interview with someone from the department. I was then brought onto campus for an interview with members of the team as well as the Assoc. Athletic Director.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a challenging situation that you faced while at work.

title: Rt Driver Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Illinois State (Normal, IL) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions:
They were very professional. Even tho I was nervous, they were willing for me to take my time.
They spoke clearly. There was a panel of three. Each one took their turn asking questions and at the end asked if I had any questions for them. Over all it was not a bad experience.
Interview Questions: What do you bring to the table

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Illinois State
Interview Descriptions: I applied onlie,through univesity's online job portal  and got inter view call within a week ,had questions  based on your previous work experience and basic web programming skills
Interview Questions: previous web development experiance

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Illinois State (Normal, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Completed research presentation, met with faculty in small groups.  Met with Chair and Dean individually.  Whole process took 1.5 days.  Also included campus and community tours.  Whole process was very professional and well organized.
Interview Questions: Asked about research stream and teaching philosophy primarily.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Illinois State (Normal, IL) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by two people - the head of the department and the person who held the position I was applying for. The meeting was held in a conference room. I was asked questions by both interviewers. The questions lasted for 10-15 minutes. Afterward, I was given a chance to ask any questions I had. Once done, I was given a skills test. The test involved proofreading a one-page pager and correcting for APA formatting issues. The second part of the test involved creating a chart in Microsoft Excel to graphically represent information given on a sheet of paper. Finally, I was tasked with conducting a few basic analyses in SPSS.
Interview Questions: What type of analyses do you have experience with?

title: IT Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Illinois State
Interview Descriptions:
I applied through careers portal and was scheduled for in person after initial phone screen.
The interview itself was easy and mostly involved going over previous experiences.
There were basic programming questions
Interview Questions: Basic technical questions

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Illinois State
Interview Descriptions: Simple and focused on your knowledge and approach to tutoring. They really wanted to know from the beginning if you were serious or not about helping students or just making some money. One in person interview was the only part of the process at all, at least for me
Interview Questions: How would you handle a student who has given up?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Illinois State
Interview Descriptions: Normal questions. Why do you want to work here? Tell me about a time when you... (use the situation-action-results method to answer). Met with the boss, department head, future coworkers, and took maybe an hour. Dress professionally, bring your A-game. You'll be competing against 4-8 other applicants so it isn't a freebie job.
Interview Questions: If you were asked to do two very vital tasks but only had the time to do one because of coursework, what would you do?

title: UTA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Illinois State (Normal, IL) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Know the person who's hiring, do well in a class. That's pretty much all there is to it. If you have previous tutor or TA experience, obviously talk about that. It varies from department to department but a lot of the TAs just sort of walk into the position from my understanding. Don't worry about it though, I don't think many people apply for these positions.
Interview Questions: Do you want the job?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Illinois State (Bloomington, IL) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: No interview process. I just sent my application and an email to the director of econ department. then i meet him in person after a month when I moved to the United States to study and work at the same time. it was a great experience working at Illinois State University. I met so many faculty members. the environment is so friendly and warm.
Interview Questions: why yo want to be in ISU?

title: Preview Guide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Illinois State (Normal, IL) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: There were 3 interviews from former guides, one from a faculty member on campus, then one at the end with head preview staff. Ask you a wide variety of questions pertaining to your experiences.
Interview Questions: What would you do with 1 million dollars?

title: Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Illinois State in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: For a student, it was very straightforward in the initial group interview in regards to seeing how well I worked together with a team. In the individual interview, there is a lot of standard interview questions.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest strength? What is your biggest weakness? How do your experiences align with being an Admissions Tour Team member?

title: Student Manager Campus Dining Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Illinois State (Normal, IL) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview is set up as follows: sit down in front of hiring office workers and administrators, they take turns asking you questions. Only last about a half hour to 45 minutes
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself?
Leadership Experience? 
What makes you a top candidate for this job?

title: Senator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Illinois State
Interview Descriptions: Position openings are posted on the SGA website.  In order to apply one must fill out an application and have an up to date resume.  Just drop off the resume and application in the office, make sure you include all contact info, and someone on SGA should notify you about your application.
Interview Questions: It changes year to year but most often they will ask you the basic questions (strengths weaknesses, handle a difficult situation, etc.) and then one of the harder questions you will be asked is about what you want SGA to do and how you can help make that happen.  It's hard because you actually have to think about what you want to accomplish on SGA and because if you aren't experienced with SGA you don't know what is possible/impossible/improbable/illegal/etc.

title: Student Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Illinois State (Normal, IL) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Took a while but once I got in and had the interview, the process when quick. It took a while for them to initially call me but after the interview I think I only waited about a week for my offer.
Interview Questions: General internet browsing questions

title: Front Desk/Secretary At Student Activities & Involvement Office Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Illinois State (Normal, IL) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: You apply online and you are called based on your involvement and achievements in school.  Also, if you seem too busy, they will not bother to call you because they don't think you'd be able to cover the front desk as often.  They are really friendly and will hire you based on how approachable you are or how friendly you are.
Interview Questions: What are three things your friends would say about you?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Illinois State (Normal, IL) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: No interview process, there was only a letter of intent required stating why you wanted to teach, your teaching philosophy, and who inspires you as a student and how you think you would be as an instructor when you are in front of the classroom. Many behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: What is your teaching philosophy?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Illinois State
Interview Descriptions: Apply Online. Interview in person, lasts about 60 minutes.
Interview Questions: What do you expect from us?

title: Campus Dining Services Student Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Illinois State (Normal, IL) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: Apply online, then called in for an interview, only one interview but by a panel made up of one student manager from the Central Hiring Office and two or three administrators, dressed business professional, acted confident, and answer basic part-time job interview questions - most difficult question (personally) asked was to describe a time of difficult and the steps I took to overcome that difficulty.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Illinois State (Normal, IL) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is highly competitive. First there are many applicants for the same job and then after your resume is selected there is an interview that a candidate needs to pass. Once you crack the interview you get the job. The main difficulty is to get your resume selected by the interviewer.
Interview Questions: General Background

title: Personal Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Illinois State (Normal, IL) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was a screening interview done by student managers who worked at the rec. Basically it was to see if you were a good fit to be considered for an interview with the Training Coordinator. The second interview was with the Coordinator, who got into more specific and in-depth questions regarding training.
Interview Questions: What is something new that you would bring to the training staff?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Illinois State (Normal, IL) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was told to apply on their website. After 3 months of no notice, I was called in 4 days before the joining date for an interview and was told that there was not a full-time GA position left but a part time one which would still give me a full ride.
Interview Questions: Why should we let you teach

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Illinois State (Normal, IL) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: I did not have much of an interview process with ISU. When I received the position I was already a graduate student so I just had to submit an application and then do a short phone interview which involved calling a specific number, listening to a prompt and answering the question in Spanish.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: MSA Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Illinois State
Interview Descriptions:
Attend one of the mandatory Recruitment Sessions listed below. Applicants that have not attended a recruitment session during the current academic year will be removed from consideration for that hiring session.  Recruitment sessions will last approximately one hour, and no entry is allowed after the session begins.
Prepare a resume and cover letter. See the Career Center for assistance in creating a resume and cover letter.
Complete an Online Application by visiting www.IllinoisState.edu/jobs/.  Position postings are active during the week of each recruitment session starting Monday morning through Wednesday at 4 p.m.
Complete and attach the Recruitment Card (available during open hiring sessions) to your online application.
Only complete applications will be considered.  Qualified candidates will be selected for interviews.
Interview Questions: What does unity meant?

title: Network Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Illinois State (Normal, IL) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: I met with the interview team that consisted of the network manager and assistant director. They asked basic questions about troubleshooting a networked device. They weren't really looking for networking experience outside of how to ping a device or run a traceroute, but more potential to train and motivation to learn.
Interview Questions: Basic network questions. Ping, trace route, how to troubleshoot things.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Illinois State in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process began by applying to Illinois State University's online job board.  I waiting for a phone call, which came a couple of weeks later, and completed a phone interview with the employer.  After a phone interview I was asked to come in and speak to the employer for a face-to-face interview.  After the interview was over I was able to accept the job the next day after receiving a call back from the department.
Interview Questions: What are you looking to get out of this job if you were to get it?

title: Front Desk Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Illinois State (Normal, IL) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: I got a call, i was asked a series of questions related to receptionist tasks. The interview was pretty easy, and the interviewer was very nice and made me worry less. It was over the phone, so that probably had something to do with it.
Interview Questions: Basic interview questions

title: IT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Illinois State (Normal, IL) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward process. Great employer.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Computer Programmer III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Illinois State (Normal, IL) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: It was easy going. About one hour, with a two person panel. Questions were mostly focused what I had done in the previous job. Asked me if I could show them some previous projects. Got the offer after about one week. Since it was part time job, there was basically no space to negotiate wage. Over all it was positive.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Director Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Illinois State (Normal, IL) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Normal process
Interview Questions: Why are you applying for this job?

title: PR Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Illinois State (Normal, IL) in Dec 2010
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward. I submitted a portfolio and an application, they reviewed it. Contacted me for more information about myself and then I came in for an interview. The interview was with two other people. One would later become my supervisor the other was the director of the department.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Member Service Associate Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Illinois State (Normal, IL) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions:
Attended a mandatory hiring session for the campus rec. Based on my resume I got called for a student interview with present rec employees. Basic Interview questions and some situational ones. Took about 20 minutes, including wait time in lobby. 
Got a call back for a second interview with one of the bosses. Asked same questions and more situational ones. 

Question that tripped everyone up was "What does being punctual mean to you?"
Interview Questions: What does punctual mean to you?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Illinois State (Normal, IL) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: Very simple. Regular situational questions.
Interview Questions: Show a time you showed great customer service

title: Study Abroad Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at Illinois State (Normal, IL) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: I applied by submitting my resume along with a cover letter. A few weeks later I was contacted by the office for an interview. The longest wait was between the interview and knowing whether or not I had gotten the job--this was about a month or so. The interview was approximately 30-45 minutes long, and was done by three of the current employees. They asked standard questions about previous experience and about my time abroad.
Interview Questions: There really were not any unexpected or difficult questions. Pretty straight forward.

title: Instructional Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Illinois State (Normal, IL) in Jun 2008
Interview Descriptions: Saw an ad to teach one management course.  Applied and received a phone interview from the department chairperson (director).  During first interview, was asked to come in for a second interview with department chairperson.  At that time, I was asked if I was interested in a full-time position teaching, and I accepted.
Interview Questions: I don't recall any difficult or unexpected questions.  We reviewed both my resume and curriculum vitae, and discussed which management courses I could teach.
